00027 void* storage_connect(const char *hostname, const int port)
00028 {
00029     char buf[MAX_CMD_LEN];
00030     
00031     // Create a socket.
00032     int sock = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00033     if (sock < 0) {
00034         // Log the reason for the connection failure. Useful so that user knows why connection failed. 
00035         logger("Connection could not be created due to failure to create socket", LOGGING, 0);
00036         errno = ERR_CONNECTION_FAIL;
00037         return NULL;
00038     }    
00039         
00040     // Get info about the server.
00041     struct addrinfo serveraddr, *res;
00042     memset(&serveraddr, 0, sizeof serveraddr);
00043     serveraddr.ai_family = AF_UNSPEC;
00044     serveraddr.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
00045     char portstr[MAX_PORT_LEN];
00046     snprintf(portstr, sizeof portstr, "%d", port);
00047     int status = getaddrinfo(hostname, portstr, &serveraddr, &res);
00048         
00049     if (status != 0) {
00050         // Log the reason for failure. If getaddrinfo failed it is most likely due to an incorrect hostname or server isn't running.
00051         sprintf(buf, "Error receiving server information. Verify that server is running, and that hostname '%s' is correct", hostname);
00052         logger(buf, LOGGING, 0);
00053         errno = ERR_CONNECTION_FAIL;
00054         return NULL;
00055     }
00056 
00057     // Connect to the server.
00058     status = connect(sock, res->ai_addr, res->ai_addrlen);
00059 
00060     // Log the attempted connection to the server, and the status that was received. 
00061     // This will give user useful information in case of connection failure, or success.
00062     sprintf(buf, "Attempting connection to %s:%d, received status: %d", hostname, port, status);
00063     logger(buf, LOGGING, 0);
00064         
00065     if (status != 0)
00066         {       
00067                 errno = ERR_CONNECTION_FAIL;
00068                 return NULL;
00069         }
00070 
00071         return (void*) sock;
00072 }

00078 int storage_auth(const char *username, const char *passwd, void *conn)
00079 {
00080         // Connection is really just a socket file descriptor.
00081         int sock = (int)conn;
00082 
00083         // Send some data.
00084         char buf[MAX_CMD_LEN];
00085         memset(buf, 0, sizeof buf);
00086         char *encrypted_passwd = generate_encrypted_password(passwd, NULL);
00087         snprintf(buf, sizeof buf, "AUTH %s %s\n", username, encrypted_passwd);
00088 
00089     // Log authentication success or failure to inform user of either case.
00090         if (sendall(sock, buf, strlen(buf)) == 0 && recvline(sock, buf, sizeof buf) == 0) {
00091 
00092                 int stat = checkreturnmessage(buf);
00093                 if(stat==0)
00094                 {
00095                         // If the command was successful, log the success along with the command that was sent 
00096                         char buf2[MAX_CMD_LEN + 25];
00097                         strncpy(buf2, "Server authentication successful: ", 34);
00098                         logger(strcat(buf2, buf), LOGGING, 0);
00099                         authenticated = 1;
00100                         return 0;
00101                 }
00102                 else
00103                 {
00104                         // If the command failed, log the failure along with the command that was sent 
00105                         char buf2[MAX_CMD_LEN + 25];
00106                         strncpy(buf2, "Server authentication failed: ", 29);
00107                         logger(strcat(buf2, buf), LOGGING, 0);
00108                         errno = stat;
00109                         return -1;
00110                 }
00111         }
00112     
00113         // If nothing is returned, then there is a connection problem with the server 
00114         char buf2[MAX_CMD_LEN + 25];
00115         strncpy(buf2, "Server connection failed: ", 29);
00116         logger(strcat(buf2, buf), LOGGING, 0);
00117         errno = ERR_CONNECTION_FAIL;
00118         return -1;
00119 }

00125 int storage_get(const char *table, const char *key, struct storage_record *record, void *conn)
00126 {
00127         //check if authenticated
00128         if(authenticated==0)
00129         {
00130                 errno = 3;
00131                 char buf2[MAX_CMD_LEN + 25];
00132                 strncpy(buf2, "Not authenticated", 29);
00133                 logger(buf2, LOGGING, 0);
00134                 return -1;
00135         }
00136 
00137         //check if parameters are valid
00138         int validparam;
00139         validparam = checkinvalidparam(table, 0);
00140         if(validparam == -1)
00141         {
00142                 errno = 1;
00143                 char buf2[MAX_CMD_LEN + 25];
00144                 strncpy(buf2, "Invalid Parameter", 29);
00145                 logger(buf2, LOGGING, 0);
00146                 return -1;
00147         }
00148         validparam = checkinvalidparam(key, 0);
00149         if(validparam == -1)
00150         {
00151                 errno = 1;
00152                 char buf2[MAX_CMD_LEN + 25];
00153                 strncpy(buf2, "Invalid Parameter", 29);
00154                 logger(buf2, LOGGING, 0);
00155                 return -1;
00156         }
00157 
00158         // Connection is really just a socket file descriptor.
00159         int sock = (int)conn;
00160 
00161         // Send some data.
00162         char buf[MAX_CMD_LEN];
00163         memset(buf, 0, sizeof buf);
00164         snprintf(buf, sizeof buf, "GET %s %s\n", table, key);
00165         
00166     // Log either success or failure to inform user of either case. 
00167     // User should know this information because if only one case is logged they may assume failure or success due to lack of info.
00168     if (sendall(sock, buf, strlen(buf)) == 0 && recvline(sock, buf, sizeof buf) == 0) {
00169 
00170                 int stat = checkreturnmessage(buf);
00171                 char rec[50];
00172                 char state[50];
00173                 sscanf(buf, "%s %s", state, rec);
00174                 if(stat==0)
00175                 {
00176                         // Log the command's success, along with the command itself
00177                         char buf2[MAX_CMD_LEN + 25];
00178                         strncpy(buf2, "Get command successful: ", 24);
00179                         logger(strcat(buf2, buf), LOGGING, 0); 
00180                         strncpy(record->value, rec, sizeof record->value);
00181                         return 0;
00182                 }
00183                 else
00184                 {
00185                         // Log the command's failure, along with the command itself
00186                         char buf2[MAX_CMD_LEN + 25];
00187                         strncpy(buf2, "Get Command failed: ", 29);
00188                         logger(strcat(buf2, buf), LOGGING, 0);
00189                         errno = stat;
00190                         return -1;
00191                 }
00192         }
00193 
00194     // If nothing is returned, then there is a connection problem with the server 
00195         char buf2[MAX_CMD_LEN + 25];
00196         strncpy(buf2, "Server connection failed: ", 29);
00197         logger(strcat(buf2, buf), LOGGING, 0);
00198         errno = ERR_CONNECTION_FAIL;
00199         return -1;
00200 }

00295 int storage_disconnect(void *conn)
00296 {
00297     //check invalid connection
00298     if(conn==NULL)
00299     {
00300         char buf2[MAX_CMD_LEN + 25];
00301         strncpy(buf2, "Invalid connection parameter", 29);
00302         logger(buf2, LOGGING, 0);
00303         errno = 1;
00304         return -1;
00305     }
00306     // Cleanup
00307     int sock = (int)conn;
00308     close(sock);
00309 
00310     // Log the action of closing the socket connection
00311     logger("Closed socket connection", LOGGING, 0);
00312     authenticated = 0;
00313     return 0;
00314 }
